content: pygmy puff **an original pattern by nutsaboutcroche13** *to avoid confusion i suggest looking over/reading the pattern before starting project* materials yarn bee luscious yarn in any color or fuzzy yarn you prefer 5 00 h hook or size needed to work with yarn 12mm solid black snap in/paste in eyes handful of stuffing stitch marker scissors yarn needle stitches used chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet do not join rnds w/ slp st or chain 1 @ beg of rnds unless otherwise instructed use stitch marker to mark rnds for maximum fuzziness you will need to expose the side of the stitches that are fuzziest if that side is inside the stuffie turn it inside out and continue working pygmy puff chain 2 1 6 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook 6 single_crochet 2 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 single_crochet 3 *2 single_crochet in 1st single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet* repeat *-* around 18 single_crochet 4 *2 single_crochet in 1st single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet* repeat *-* around 24 single_crochet 5-10 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 24 single_crochet 11 *single_crochet decrease in 1st single_crochet single_crochet in next 2 single_crochet* repeat *-* around 18 single_crochet for eyes between rnds 7-8 snap in/paste in eyes 12 *single_crochet decrease in 1st single_crochet single_crochet in next single_crochet* repeat *-* around 12 single_crochet stuff pygmy puff firmly 13 single_crochet decrease in each single_crochet around slp st in last single_crochet fo leaving long tail use tail to sew hole closed weave in end depending on how fluffy the pygmy puff is you may not be able to see it s eyes to fix this simply shave the fuzzy yarn around the eyes be careful not to catch your stitches the pygmy puff might fall apart copyright 2007 nutsaboutcrochet13
